runs.comm: full and swinging across Smith, tapped into the covers
wider of off this time, and left alone
Roach is unafraid to slip in the odd yorker in the opening overs, and he's aimed for one here but just slightly over-pitched. Smith clips the full toss out to deep square leg and they take two
back of a length, pitching off and moving away through the air and off the pitch. Smith shoulders arms
little inside edge off Smith's bat this time as he looks to force through the off side. The edge strikes the pad and dribbles back towards the wicket, they decide against a run

well-hit! That was very full again - perhaps another attempt at the yorker - and Smith smacked it straight down the ground, beating mid off with ease, to give South Africa their first boundary of the match in the first over
and he starts with a sharp, rising delivery on off stump. Bosman keeps his eye on it, though, dropping his hands and swaying out of the way
back of a length once again, angling into the hip but Bosman can't get him away, clipping straight to square leg

Bosman falls in identical circumstances to his dismissal yesterday! The ball was back of a length, angling at the hip and Bosman got right across his stumps to try and pull it away. Ball struck glove and Fletcher took a good tumbling catch, exactly as he did yesterday. The only difference is that this time Umpire Duncan raised the finger, instead of signalling wide...
de Villiers just thought about playing this one, which was shortish and outside off, but pulled his bat away just in time as the ball went on straight instead of coming in
clipped to square leg's right, there was perhaps a chance for a run but they decide against it
full and wobbling away through the air a touch, de Villiers drives to point
full and fast from Roach, thumping into Smith's size XL pads. Pitching outside leg though, and not even a hint of an appeal
wide of off, this one didn't get up at all after pitching, beating the underside of Smith's flashing blade
fuller this time, and closer to off stump. Smith drives watchfully into the covers
Roach pulls the length back just a touch and goes straighter still, tucking Smith up just a little. He punches into the covers, straight to the fielder
too straight this time, back of a length and Smith gets across to push the ball softly but wide of mid on, and they scamper through for a quick single
sharp movement in to the right-handed de Villiers, and some bounce too! He rode it well though, flicking to short fine leg where some sharp fielding negated the single
short and slapped to point
was that the cutter? It wasn't slower but he looked to have rolled his fingers over it. Pitching too straight, though, allowing Smith to nudge through square leg for a couple
half volley on off stump, and Smith cashes in! He thumped that straight down the ground once again. Sulieman Benn was at mid off, but couldn't get his lanky frame down in time...
short and Smith is quickly onto the pull, but hasn't found the middle with that shot. Just the one out to deep square leg
de Villiers off the mark now, as he clips a full ball - another cutter - to square leg's left
wide and Smith has a full go, but again the ball has died in the pitch, bouncing two or three times on the way through to the keeper after creeping under Smith's bat
immediately de Villiers skips down the track and cracks to long on, one run
wow, good shot this, it was a touch shorter and quicker from Benn, De Villiers hoped back in a flash and pulled very powerfully over long on for six
and the follow-up! Nicely played, if the last one was battered, this was caressed, wide of mid on for another boundary

bowled 'im! Full and fast from Taylor, the ball didn't bounce very much at all and whizzed past Smith's attempted swipe to leg to make a mess of his stumps! Smith shakes his head at the pitch as he trudges off, but while that ball kept a touch low it wasn't exactly a grubber. Taylor picks up his second wicket, and West Indies have the vital scalp of the South African captain
welcome to the crease, J.P. Short and sharp to start! Duminy sways out of the way as the ball flies past him
another bouncer! Duminy was expecting it this time though, buckling his knees to get underneath it
the rib-tickler this time, Duminy gets right across but can't get bat on it. They take a leg-bye, though his leg wasn't the least bit involved in that
short of length once again, but de Villiers stands up tall and slaps the ball down between mid off and cover, and they sprint two
big shout for lbw! That looked very close indeed as Taylor speared in a quick yorker to strike de Villiers on the toe. Not out is the decision though, just sliding down leg
predictably, he starts with a bumper! Not all that much pace, but it was short and well-directed.
flicked out to fine leg, one run the result
de Villiers slashes outside off, the ball scoots underneath the bat and Fletcher makes a good stop
full and straight, de Villiers clips to square leg but straight to the fielder
de Villiers walks across his stumps and punches the ball out to long on

well, Duminy is getting nothing at all pitched in his half of the wicket, and this time the bouncer has pinged him on the helmet! He tried to hook, but took his eyes off the ball and was hit on the back of the helmet. They pick up another 'leg-bye' to third man
and he will pitch it up, Duminy is tentatively forward though, tapping back to the bowler
on a length and straight, Duminy is back and across in solid defence. Nice, straight bat
sumptuous, classical drive from Duminy! He came forward with balance and poise and just eased the ball through the covers. It slowed up in the outfield though, so only three
and a different class of drive altogether from de Villiers, as he gets the front leg out the way and smashes the ball out to long off

de Villiers is undone by the short ball! Did the ball hold up a touch there? It wasn't that short, but spat up at him as he swivelled to pull, taking a top edge and looping ever so gently to Bravo at backward point
length to start to the new batsman, and that was quick too - for Sammy anyway. Petersen defends solidly back down the pitch
back of a length, Duminy got inside it and nudged to midwicket. Petersen wanted the run but he's sent back in time
short, bouncing up into the batsman's grille - or at least it would have, if he hadn't pulled it down to fine leg
fuller to the right-handed Petersen, who tries to work the ball to leg but finds mid on
width given by Bravo this time, and Petersen carves out to deep point for one
short again to Duminy, he's getting hardly anything at all to drive. This wasn't that well directed though, and is chopped down to backward point

again the bouncer is sent down, and Duminy has played it very awkwardly indeed. He tried to pull but was in no position to do so, the ball took the glove/arm and looped up behind square on the off side, but short of any fielders
and Petersen taps a full ball gently back to him
slipping onto the pads this time, and Petersen pulls off the front foot out to deep square leg - a dangerous shot if the ball keeps low
Duminy charges down the wicket this time to try and get closer to the ball, again it's a bouncer but this time he is able to pull it down, rolling his wrists, to midwicket
full again, Petersen drives watchfully through the covers. Playing like the opening batsman that he is
back of a length, Duminy guides the ball uppishly to third man
full and just a touch too straight, Petersen picks up one to long on
thrashed across the line out to deep square leg, and South Africa's fifty comes up
no surprises with the short ball now, Duminy backs away to give himself room with the keeper standing back and slashes the ball in the air, bisecting third man and deep point
fuller and straighter, Duminy nurdles fine on the leg side and they take one
guided off the face to third man
back of a length and bouncing up chest high, Duminy can't score off it, tapping the ball gently into the covers. Nowhere near the middle of the bat
that's the way to bowl the bouncer! Nasty, brutish bouncer from Bravo to finish, really spitting up off the pitch and Duminy ducks out of the way, turning his head away from the ball

Petersen tries the double-bluff, sticking his leg out as if he's going to step away to leg and then shuffling to off. Sammy isn't bothered though, and Petersen eventually ends up running it down to third man

back of a length bowling finally does for JP Duminy! That wasn't a bouncer but it certainly wasn't pitched up, angling across Duminy and also going away off the seam. There was a little bit of bounce on it too, enough to take the edge of his attempted cut, and Fletcher takes a really good, sharp catch standing up to the stumps. Top keeping effort there, and good bowling too
and he starts with solid defence, right behind the ball in the forward defensive
full with a bit of width, he drives languidly out to point, where a misfield from Pollard allows Miller his first runs in senior international cricket!
back of a length and Petersen chops down behind square for one
Miller bravely uses his feet, coming out and slamming the ball back to the bowler. Sammy picked it up cleanly and threatened to throw down the stumps to send Miller scampering back to his crease

premeditated paddle-sweep from Petersen, and Sulieman Benn strikes with the first ball of his spell! It was very full, delivered from round the wicket, and Petersen had set himself very early for the shot. The ball was angling towards the leg stump when it struck him on the boot, and another wicket falls!
and Botha also starts with the premeditated paddle-sweep, but he's got a lot of bat on this one to send it out to long leg
ooh, almost another one for Big Benn there! Miller tried to flick to leg but the ball took the leading edge and flew agonisingly short of the cover fielder. Close!
Miller dances down the track to take the ball on the full toss, and picks up two down the ground

again Miller uses his feet, really well and get's a clean connection on the lofted shot down the ground! Great shot there, he got a lot on that and the ball flew way over the boundary straight down the ground. That's what South Africa need!
fuller, quicker, and Miller clips out on the leg side to keep the strike
Miller backs away, giving himself some room but Sammy follows him. A clipped single to midwicket is the result
Botha is pinned on the pads as he's stuck on the crease, but he's struck way too high to elicit the appeal. Leg-byes down to third man
chipped down to long off, another scampered one. Miller was too soon into the drive but went through with it all the same, hence the ball went in the air down to the fielder
big swipe across the line from Botha, but he missed completely. More smart work from Fletcher behind the stumps as he collects cleanly.
full, straight and Botha pushes back to the bowler
just a little wide of off, and on a length. Botha opens the face to collect one down to third man and keep the strike
and he's on the money straight away, with a length ball that jags viciously in to the right-handed Botha. But he's equal to it, getting right behind the ball in defence
back of a length this time, but Botha rides the bounce as he nudges to leg. Can't find the run though
sprayed down leg by Roach

that was one spicy meatball from Roach! That could've taken Botha's head off, it was past him before he even thought to duck. Luckily it really spat up off the pitch to go over him. Again, Fletcher does well behind the stumps to keep byes to one
Miller backs away to give himself room, but crunches a shot straight to the cover fielder
and again he backs away, this time the ball comes off the inside edge, strikes the pad, and Botha calls him through
back of a length but too far outside off, Botha guides the ball behind square for one
Botha pulls out to deep square leg, just the one though as there's a fielder out there

Miller makes room and aims a slashing drive through the off side. There wasn't much pace on the ball though, and he was through with the shot before the ball got to him, sending it into the leg side instead

ooh, bad miss there! That should have been a simple chance, as Miller gets right underneath an attempted mow to leg. The ball flew miles in the air, but the fielder at long on, for some reason, couldn't get to it. He could have been underneath it easily
and that rubs it in even more! Same shot from Miller but this time he's nailed it. Huge shot right over long on, great connection, great timing!
off the inside edge and onto the pad, no run though
was that really a wide? The ball barely got up over his head and was right over the stumps. Pollard isn't happy with the call, and I must say I can see why
Miller slashes a cut out to deep point, they sprint two
attempted slog sweep, the ball strikes the toe of the bat and goes towards short third man. Miller calls him through for a sneaky single, and get's back on strike
Miller tries to clear the leg and heave to long on, can't get a good connection though and midwicket cleans up
down the wicket to take the ball on the full, hammered down to long on
Botha tries the reverse sweep this time, again he doesn't pull off the shot though, missing completely outside off
driven down to long on
Miller backs right away from his stumps and carves a low full toss out to the cover sweeper
very full from round the wicket, Miller jams his bat down on the yorker and they scramble through for one
Botha is down the track and swatting, flat-batted out to long on
lofted down to long off, not timed particularly well though, and bouncing well short of the fielder
another short ball, Botha stays deep in the crease and pulls out to midwicket, where Sarwan runs across to keep them to two. And that brings up the South African 100
hoicked across the line down to long on
full and wide, Miller thrashes to Gayle at wide mid off and they steal a run
short of a length, Miller is on the back foot in a flash and pulling hard out to deep square leg
quick and bouncy from Roach! He gave Botha some room outside off but the ball flashed past him almost before he was into the shot

well, that one wasn't too fast for Botha! It was much fuller and straighter and Botha carved through the line to send the ball sailing out over the boundary at wide long on. And that's landed right in the swimming pool in the spectator's area! Yep, they're asking for a new ball now, the old one is soaking wet!

what a shot! Brave stuff from Botha, he gets down low to paddle scoop the ball down to fine leg, and he's hit it so well that that's gone for six! He had the pace to work with, and he did wonderfully well
swishing across the line this time, and the ball flies through to Fletcher
hammered down to long on for one

Botha perishes for the cause. He was aiming right down the ground with a lofted smear, but sliced at the ball just a touch, and mid off set himself underneath the swirling ball to take a regulation catch. Not much else Botha could have tried to do, but West Indies will be glad to see the back of him after his striking in the last over
very wide full toss outside off, Miller throws his bat at it to send the ball out into the covers

McLaren is down setting himself for the paddle-scoop, but its a quick length ball  which strikes the glove and rolls away behind square on the off side. Absolutely manic running sees them home despite a shy at the stumps
another full toss thrashed out to long off
very full again and angling in to the pads from round the wicket, he's got something on that to send the ball down to fine leg

Miller goes for an almighty heave over the leg side and misses completely, McLaren calls him through for a stolen bye but Fletcher reacts quickly, lobbing the ball to Taylor who flicks the ball at the stumps with Miller well short
